intro: Disterigma ovatum, commonly known as the white-flowered disterigma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy white flowers with five petals. Its leaves are ovate and have a serrated edge, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Disterigma ovatum is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
